translation.text: Airport & South Line, Cumberland Line, Inner West & Leppington Line - Good service

Some trains have been removed from service as they are undergoing urgent maintenance following damage caused by the recent severe storms last weekend.  Specific service cancellation information can be found when you plan your trip in the real-time apps.

Olympic Park Line services will run to a reduced frequency until Friday due to essential train maintenance following damage caused by the recent severe storms. Services to and from Lidcombe will run every 20 minutes. You can also choose to utilise local bus routes 525 & 526. Before you travel, plan your trip using one of our Transport apps or at transportnsw.info

A frequent replacement bus service is in operation between Bathurst, Lithgow, and Springwood due to a landslide at Leura and infrastructure damage caused by recent bushfires. Due to the nature of these incidents the line between Mount Victoria and Springwood is expected to remain closed for at least the remainder of the week. Due to the extent of the damage caused by the bushfires, buses will continue to replace trains between Mount Victoria and Lithgow for some time. We will continue to keep you informed as these incidents progress. Please listen to announcements, check indicator boards, and monitor Transport apps for updates or plan your trip at transportnsw.info/trip

With ongoing rainfall being experienced and heavy falls predicted in some areas, train services and station facilities may be impacted on some lines. Before you travel please check Transport apps for up-to-date train running information. Also be weather wise and avoid rushing and stepping in puddles to prevent slips, trips and falls.

NSW Premier's Gala Concerts 2020: First State Super Theatre - International Convention Centre (ICC) Sydney, Darling Harbour
Concert 1 - 11:15 and Concert 2 - 14:45
- The closest station to concert venue at ICC Sydney is Central. From Central change for a L1 Dulwich Hill light rail service to Exhibition Centre Stop
- Alternatively the venue is a 1.1km walk from the station

Women's Football Olympic Qualifiers: Australia v China - Western Sydney Stadium, Parramatta
19:30 until 21:30
- Valid pre-purchased match tickets to Stadium include travel on Sydney Trains and Sydney Metro services.
- The stadium is a 15 minutes walk from Parramatta station via Argyle St, Church St, the Riverside Walk.

Details: https://transportnsw.info/events/2020/02

This service will consist of four carriages instead of eight due to the displacement of train services following a landslide at Leura. Please move toward the centre of the platform to board this serviceÂ¿

Due to a train requiring mechanical repairs this service will consist of 4 cars instead of 8. Please move towards the middle of the platform.

Customers, due to Wynyard station upgrades the lifts from George Street to Concourse Level will be closed until July 2020.   During these works, Customers will be able use alternate lifts from Wynyard Station to Carrington Street and York Street accessed via Margaret Street.  For further information or assistance, Please follow station staff instructions, station signage or call Wynyard Station on 9224 2959.

The lift between the concourse and platform 2 is temporarily out of service. Customers travelling from the city who require lift access should alight at International Airport station and catch a service from platform 1 back to Domestic Airport station. You can also call 8337 8450 for assistance.

Croydon & Newtown Stations - External power supply issues are affecting platform screens, Opal card readers and station lighting. For Opal information or fare adjustments, please visit transportnsw.info/opal.
Station Update - Blacktown, Central, Parramatta and more

Due to a landslide at Leura and damage caused by recent bushfires, many Blue Mountains Line train services have been operating as 4 carriages instead of 8. We kindly ask that customers travelling to stations between Penrith and the city board T1 Western Line services to avoid congestion on Blue Mountains Line trains

The public toilets at Beverly Hills station are currently unavailable while major repairs take place. Temporary toilets have been provided and are located outside the station on Tooronga Terrace. These facilities can be accessed during staffed hours. We apologise for any inconvenience.

Due to station maintenance works, the pedestrian ramp between Richmond Platform 2 and the concourse is closed. If you are unable to use the stairs, a shuttle bus to and from East Richmond station will be available.   For further assistance, please see station staff or call 9851 7248.

The public toilets at St James Station are closed while major works are taking place. Public toilets are located at the Elizabeth Street entrance to the right and in Hyde Park through the Macquarie Street tunnel up the stairs to the right. We apologise for any inconvenience.

New Metro Platforms are being constructed on platforms 1 & 2 at Sydenham Station. T3 Bankstown Line services to the City operate from platform 3 & T3 Bankstown Line services to Lidcombe and Liverpool operate from platform 4. Platform 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works - A new Metro concourse is also being constructed at the Northern end of the station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please see staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info
